reviews.text: My husband and I had so looked forward to staying at Bussaco as the travel guides I had used to research this former Portuguese Palace gave it a glowing report but this was unfortunately not the case when we visited.One nights accommodation was180 euros for a standard classic double (we were given 2 single beds).The room was located in the older convent building attached to the Palace and it was not the luxurious room we had imagined but a rather tired and shabby room much in need of a refurbishment.We were surprised at the lack of people staying at the Palace and it appeared virtually empty despite the tables in the dining rooms set as if to give the impression of a bustling hotel.The Restaurant that boasts as being one of Portugal's most renowned was terrible- the worst food and most expensive ( dinner set menu-40 euro each) the main course was inedible-we did not stay for dessert.Breakfast was unmemorable accompanied by the same waitress who had served us the previous night who sniffed with sickening regularity.On a more positive note the beautiful Palace is definitely worth a visit and the woodland that encompasses it is a delight but would recommend a day trip and seek accomodation in nearby Luso!

reviews.text: My husband is interested in the Peninsular Wars -hence we booked this hotel in Bussaco. After reading reviews we thought it was going to be an expensive battle site visit!!However we had a wonderful time. Staff friendly and helpful -the minute we were spotted on arrival our cases were whisked away. We had the room used by Agatha Christie and it was lovely -large, tons of storage , nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. Okay ,it isn't modern-all glass and mirrors- but in keeping with the period. Beware the 40 euro menu option -my husband who can eat for Wales regretfully couldn't do it justice! Will agree with the forest map - a few signposts would help enormously. Can't wait to revisit

reviews.text: My third short visit.... this is a real old palace so expect creaking floors but its just wonderful. Good winter rates about 80euro per night for 2 people and with a breakfast which will see you through the day. Set in a forest and a short drive up to the cross at the top with views to die for, on a clear day the sea can be seen, so peaceful. The spa town of Luso is just a few minutes drive.... The Bussaco Palace Hotel is my utopia.

There is a point at which "charm" becomes "delapidated". Unfortunately, this property has reached this point. Having read numerous reviews on TripAdvisor celebrating the fantasy of this fairyland castle, my family was expecting something very different. Don't be fooled bny the one pretty picture of the swan in the "pond" with the castle in the back. It's the only spectacular photo in the place. This is a Madonna Inn (San Louis Obisbo, California - fairly tacky, touristy) with cobwebs. We were scheduled to stay here for 2 nights but, at 4:00am, on our first night in a 16th century bed, flies all over the place, and creaking floors, I announced to my wife that we were out of there in the morning. In its defense, the staff was wonderful and accomodating, offering us all types of options to stay. No way! The dinner at the restaurant was very good (say, 13/20 Gault-Millau) with large portions though overpriced. Tour buses come and go, gawking at the facade and the worn, bizarre lobby. And the grounds, while extensive, are no prettier than any nice state park. And the place, especially by Portuegse standards is a fortune. (We stayed at a lovely hotel in Porto - 4 stars - for 2 night for 1/2 the price of one night here.) For sure, a $100 million might make this property into what it claims (and would like to be). But, for the moment, they are still short $100 million in repairs.
